action.action-desc: Mr. McGarvey (for himself and Mr. Bilirakis) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide for adjustments to the Medicare part D cost-sharing reductions for low-income individuals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Cutting Copays Act.

section.header: Adjustments to Medicare part D cost-sharing reductions for low-income individuals
section.text: Section 1860D–14(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–114(a)) is amended in paragraph (1)(D)(ii)—

paragraph.text: by striking that does not exceed $1 for and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting

subclause.text: for plan years before plan year 2024—

item.text: for a generic drug or a preferred drug that is a multiple source drug (as defined in section 1927(k)(7)(A)(i)), $1 or, if less, the copayment amount applicable to an individual under clause (iii); and
for any other drug, $3 or, if less, the copayment amount applicable to an individual under clause (iii); and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subclauses:

item.text: for any other drug, the dollar amount applied under this clause (after application of paragraph (4)(A)) for plan year 2023 for a drug described in subclause (I)(bb); and

subclause.text: for a subsequent year, the dollar amount applied under this clause for the previous year for the drug, increased by the annual percentage increase in the consumer price index (all items; U.S. city average) as of September of such previous year.
